item.title: A very big dip, subsidence in road, 9th September
item.description:
Noticed approx on 6th Sept a huge dip subsidence in road. Driving from Kentucky Fried Chicken on Manor RD DA8 pass City Brakers on my left, my right wheel dipped into road, it was a massive dip....just before Frobisher Rd. Extremely dangerous, especially in the dark, can't see it ahead until you are in it! Poss due to all the heavy work trucks using the rd, poss develop into sink hole.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 185, Manor Road, Slade Green, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Red path stairs to Mabley, 9th September
item.description:
The handrail is not sufficient very dangerous it stops and elderly and partially sighted are holding onto the brick wall to ascend and descend the stairs which are uneven and broken and chipped in places. It need urgently looking and fixing pls

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Edmeston Close, Hackney, London

item.title: Loud roadworks Monday at 23:23, 8th September
item.description:
There is unacceptably loud roadworks being done on a Monday evening. We noticed loud drilling at 21:30. Since then roadwork has been consistently loud. There is currently (23:30) a loud construction vehicle and truck running with intermittent drilling. On a weekday after 9pm is completely unreasonable!!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 132, Grosvenor Road, Pimlico, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Roadworks noise on a Monday at 23:27, 8th September
item.description:
There is loud drilling and trucks working on a Monday night. The drilling began around 9:30pm and as of 11:28pm they are continuing to drill. This is unnacceptable. We can hear the sound with our windows closed.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 130, Grosvenor Road, Pimlico, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 2 old beds dropped on the pavement., 8th September
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Camelot Close, London

item.title: Damaged paving around electrical connection post, 8th September
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 12, Broadley Street, St. John's Wood, London

item.title: Broken palette left leaning against 33 Copleston Road Wall, 8th September
item.description:
Broken palette left leaning against 33 Copleston Road, and another one left by the bins (reported separately) but likely came from the same culprit. These were spotted the morning of the 8th of September 2025, they weren't there the night before.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 33, Copleston Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Broken Palette left next to 33 Copleston Bins, 8th September
item.description:
Someone has left a broken palette by the bins at 33 Copleston Road, didnt see who it was, a neighbour was clearing out their front porch and there is some building work across the road so it could have come from there but it wasn't dumped by any of the inhabitants at 33 Copleston Road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 33, Copleston Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet
